TypeSignature.Value: public class File : Java.Lang.Object, IDisposable, Java.IO.ISerializable, Java.Lang.IComparable
.class public auto ansi beforefieldinit File extends Java.Lang.Object implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.IO.ISerializable, class Java.Lang.IComparable, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: An "abstract" representation of a file system entity identified by a pathname.

remarks.para: An "abstract" representation of a file system entity identified by a pathname. The pathname may be absolute (relative to the root directory of the file system) or relative to the current directory in which the program is running.
The actual file referenced by a File may or may not exist. It may also, despite the name File, be a directory or other non-regular file.
This class provides limited functionality for getting/setting file permissions, file type, and last modified time.

On Android strings are converted to UTF-8 byte sequences when sending filenames to the operating system, and byte sequences returned by the operating system (from the various list methods) are converted to strings by decoding them as UTF-8 byte sequences.

Docs.summary: Constructs a new File using the path of the specified URI.

remarks.para: Constructs a new File using the path of the specified URI. uri needs to be an absolute and hierarchical Unified Resource Identifier with file scheme and non-empty path component, but with undefined authority, query or fragment components.

Docs.exception: if uri does not comply with the conditions above.

Docs.summary: Constructs a new File using the specified directory path and file name, placing a path separator between the two.

remarks.para: Constructs a new File using the specified directory path and file name, placing a path separator between the two.

Docs.summary: Returns a new file constructed using the absolute path of this file.

remarks.para: Returns a new file constructed using the absolute path of this file. Equivalent to new File(this.getAbsolutePath()).

Docs.summary: Returns the absolute path of this file.

remarks.para: Returns the absolute path of this file. An absolute path is a path that starts at a root of the file system. On Android, there is only one root: /.

A common use for absolute paths is when passing paths to a Process as command-line arguments, to remove the requirement implied by relative paths, that the child must have the same working directory as its parent.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool CanExecute() cil managed

Docs.summary: Tests whether or not this process is allowed to execute this file.

remarks.para: Tests whether or not this process is allowed to execute this file. Note that this is a best-effort result; the only way to be certain is to actually attempt the operation.

Docs.summary: Returns a new file created using the canonical path of this file.

remarks.para: Returns a new file created using the canonical path of this file. Equivalent to new File(this.getCanonicalPath()).

Docs.summary: Returns the canonical path of this file.

remarks.para: Returns the canonical path of this file. An absolute path is one that begins at the root of the file system. A canonical path is an absolute path with symbolic links and references to "." or ".." resolved. If a path element does not exist (or is not searchable), there is a conflict between interpreting canonicalization as a textual operation (where "a/../b" is "b" even if "a" does not exist) .

Most callers should use instead. A canonical path is significantly more expensive to compute, and not generally useful. The primary use for canonical paths is determining whether two paths point to the same file by comparing the canonicalized paths.

It can be actively harmful to use a canonical path, specifically because canonicalization removes symbolic links. It's wise to assume that a symbolic link is present for a reason, and that that reason is because the link may need to change. Canonicalization removes this layer of indirection. Good code should generally avoid caching canonical paths.

Docs.param: a file to compare this file to

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool CreateNewFile() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a new, empty file on the file system according to the path information stored in this file.

remarks.para: Creates a new, empty file on the file system according to the path information stored in this file. This method returns true if it creates a file, false if the file already existed. Note that it returns false even if the file is not a file (because it's a directory, say).
This method is not generally useful. For creating temporary files, use instead. For reading/writing files, use , , or , all of which can create files.
Note that this method does not throw IOException if the file already exists, even if it's not a regular file. Callers should always check the return value, and may additionally want to call .

Docs.exception: if it's not possible to create the file.

Docs.param: the prefix to the temp file name.
the suffix to the temp file name.
Docs.summary: Creates an empty temporary file using the given prefix and suffix as part of the file name.

remarks.para: Creates an empty temporary file using the given prefix and suffix as part of the file name. If suffix is null, .tmp is used. This method is a convenience method that calls with the third argument being null.

Docs.exception: if an error occurs when writing the file.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Java.IO.File CreateTempFile (string prefix, string suffix, Java.IO.File directory);
.method public static hidebysig class Java.IO.File CreateTempFile(string prefix, string suffix, class Java.IO.File directory) cil managed

Docs.param: the prefix to the temp file name.
the suffix to the temp file name.

the location to which the temp file is to be written, or null for the default location for temporary files, which is taken from the "java.io.tmpdir" system property. It may be necessary to set this property to an existing, writable directory for this method to work properly.
Docs.summary: Creates an empty temporary file in the given directory using the given prefix and suffix as part of the file name.

remarks.para: Creates an empty temporary file in the given directory using the given prefix and suffix as part of the file name. If suffix is null, .tmp is used.
Note that this method does not call , but see the documentation for that method before you call it manually.

Docs.exception: if the length of prefix is less than 3.
if an error occurs when writing the file.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool Delete() cil managed

Docs.summary: Deletes this file.

remarks.para: Deletes this file. Directories must be empty before they will be deleted.
Note that this method does not throw IOException on failure. Callers must check the return value.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void DeleteOnExit() cil managed

Docs.summary: Schedules this file to be automatically deleted when the VM terminates normally.

remarks.para: Schedules this file to be automatically deleted when the VM terminates normally.

Note that on Android, the application lifecycle does not include VM termination, so calling this method will not ensure that files are deleted . Instead, you should use the most appropriate out of:
Use a finally clause to manually invoke .
Maintain your own set of files to delete, and process it at an appropriate point in your application's lifecycle.
Use the Unix trick of deleting the file as soon as all readers and writers have opened it. No new readers/writers will be able to access the file, but all existing ones will still have access until the last one closes the file.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool Exists() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a boolean indicating whether this file can be found on the underlying file system.

remarks.para: Returns a boolean indicating whether this file can be found on the underlying file system.

Docs.summary: Returns the number of free bytes on the partition containing this path.

remarks.para: Returns the number of free bytes on the partition containing this path. Returns 0 if this path does not exist.
Note that this is likely to be an optimistic over-estimate and should not be taken as a guarantee your application can actually write this many bytes.

Docs.summary: Indicates if this file's pathname is absolute.

remarks.para: Indicates if this file's pathname is absolute. Whether a pathname is absolute is platform specific. On Android, absolute paths start with the character '/'.

Docs.summary: Indicates if this file represents a directory on the underlying file system.

remarks.para: Indicates if this file represents a directory on the underlying file system.

Docs.summary: Indicates if this file represents a file on the underlying file system.

remarks.para: Indicates if this file represents a file on the underlying file system.

Docs.summary: Returns whether or not this file is a hidden file as defined by the operating system.

remarks.para: Returns whether or not this file is a hidden file as defined by the operating system. The notion of "hidden" is system-dependent. For Unix systems a file is considered hidden if its name starts with a ".". For Windows systems there is an explicit flag in the file system for this purpose.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string[] List() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns an array of strings with the file names in the directory represented by this file.

remarks.para: Returns an array of strings with the file names in the directory represented by this file. The result is null if this file is not a directory.
The entries . and .. representing the current and parent directory are not returned as part of the list.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string[] List(class Java.IO.IFilenameFilter filter) cil managed

Docs.param: the filter to match names against, may be null.
Docs.summary: Gets a list of the files in the directory represented by this file.

remarks.para: Gets a list of the files in the directory represented by this file. This list is then filtered through a FilenameFilter and the names of files with matching names are returned as an array of strings. Returns null if this file is not a directory. If filter is null then all filenames match.
The entries . and .. representing the current and parent directories are not returned as part of the list.

Docs.summary: Returns an array of files contained in the directory represented by this file.

remarks.para: Returns an array of files contained in the directory represented by this file. The result is null if this file is not a directory. The paths of the files in the array are absolute if the path of this file is absolute, they are relative otherwise.

The entries . and .. representing the current and parent directories are not returned as part of the list.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool Mkdir() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates the directory named by this file, assuming its parents exist.

remarks.para: Creates the directory named by this file, assuming its parents exist. Use if you also want to create missing parents.

Note that this method does not throw IOException on failure. Callers must check the return value. Note also that this method returns false if the directory already existed. If you want to know whether the directory exists on return, either use (f.mkdir() || f.isDirectory()) or simply ignore the return value from this method and simply call .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool Mkdirs() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates the directory named by this file, creating missing parent directories if necessary.

remarks.para: Creates the directory named by this file, creating missing parent directories if necessary. Use if you don't want to create missing parents.

Note that this method does not throw IOException on failure. Callers must check the return value. Note also that this method returns false if the directory already existed. If you want to know whether the directory exists on return, either use (f.mkdirs() || f.isDirectory()) or simply ignore the return value from this method and simply call .

Docs.summary: Returns the name of the file or directory represented by this file.

remarks.para: Returns the name of the file or directory represented by this file.

Docs.summary: Returns the pathname of the parent of this file.

remarks.para: Returns the pathname of the parent of this file. This is the path up to but not including the last name. null is returned if there is no parent.

Docs.summary: Returns a new file made from the pathname of the parent of this file.

remarks.para: Returns a new file made from the pathname of the parent of this file. This is the path up to but not including the last name. null is returned when there is no parent.

Docs.summary: Returns the path of this file.

remarks.para: Returns the path of this file.

Docs.summary: The system-dependent string used to separate components in search paths (":").

remarks.para: The system-dependent string used to separate components in search paths (":"). See .

Docs.summary: The system-dependent character used to separate components in search paths (':').

remarks.para: The system-dependent character used to separate components in search paths (':'). This is used to split such things as the PATH environment variable and classpath system properties into lists of directories to be searched.
This field is initialized from the system property "path.separator". Later changes to that property will have no effect on this field or this class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool RenameTo(class Java.IO.File newPath) cil managed

Docs.summary: Renames this file to newPath.

remarks.para: Renames this file to newPath. This operation is supported for both files and directories.

Many failures are possible. Some of the more likely failures include:
Write permission is required on the directories containing both the source and destination paths.
Search permission is required for all parents of both paths.
Both paths be on the same mount point. On Android, applications are most likely to hit this restriction when attempting to copy between internal storage and an SD card.
Note that this method does not throw IOException on failure. Callers must check the return value.

Docs.summary: The system-dependent string used to separate components in filenames ('/').

remarks.para: The system-dependent string used to separate components in filenames ('/'). See .

Docs.summary: The system-dependent character used to separate components in filenames ('/').

remarks.para: The system-dependent character used to separate components in filenames ('/'). Use of this (rather than hard-coding '/') helps portability to other operating systems.
This field is initialized from the system property "file.separator". Later changes to that property will have no effect on this field or this class.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.

Docs.summary: Returns the total size in bytes of the partition containing this path.

remarks.para: Returns the total size in bytes of the partition containing this path. Returns 0 if this path does not exist.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Java.Net.URI ToURI() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a Uniform Resource Identifier for this file.

remarks.para: Returns a Uniform Resource Identifier for this file. The URI is system dependent and may not be transferable between different operating / file systems.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Java.Net.URL ToURL() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a Uniform Resource Locator for this file.

remarks.para: Returns a Uniform Resource Locator for this file. The URL is system dependent and may not be transferable between different operating / file systems.

Docs.exception: if the path cannot be transformed into a URL.

Docs.summary: Returns the number of usable free bytes on the partition containing this path.

remarks.para: Returns the number of usable free bytes on the partition containing this path. Returns 0 if this path does not exist.

Note that this is likely to be an optimistic over-estimate and should not be taken as a guarantee your application can actually write this many bytes. On Android (and other Unix-based systems), this method returns the number of free bytes available to non-root users, regardless of whether you're actually running as root, and regardless of any quota or other restrictions that might apply to the user. (The getFreeSpace method returns the number of bytes potentially available to root.)
